column4: heyas. i just installed ubuntu hoary from the CD. and am reading ubuntu guide. after installing, i just updated my sources.list from ubuntuguide website and did apt-get update. but i get an error with the nerim.net entry, what do i do to correct it so the error goes away?
but i'd rather not have it. I know that i need to import the keys probably, but i dunno howto :)
now do i need to apt-get upgrade?
and how do i stop some packages from upgrading, like if it wants to update 1,2,3, but i wanmt to stop 1 and install 2 and 3, then how do i make it do that?
dpkg --set-selections pkgname hold
ok.
replace 'hold' with 'install' to turn that off when its no longer broken...
yeah, the dpkg --set-selections pkgname hold is right i think.
it really means your user
if thats broken (its saying that its reporting the incident) you need to boot to rescue mode and add your user to /etc/sudoers
I don't think that qualifies as "sometime" ... not in that sense at least  :)
umm... most like Evolution  :/
second icon from System (or Computer... depending on version)
apt-get autoclean
yeah... umm... could try just changing the icon instead?
you have no idea what a kernel is huh?
sure it would... a peice of paper with a green foot on it here  :/
via 'Music Player' in Sound and Video after doing what thoreauputic just said  ;)
that ought to be /mnt/windows (or simular) ... but I'll let it slide  :P
one day... look up FHS  :)   (filesystem hiarchy standard)
